humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, sentinel lymph node #1 has positive metastatic carcinoma (1/1) and the other two sentinel lymph nodes (#2 and #3) are negative (0/1). Therefore, the patient has metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes, which corresponds to the N1 stage based on the AJCC staging system.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for this patient is N1 because there is metastatic carcinoma found in one sentinel lymph node (specimen A) out of the three examined (specimens A, B, and C). The report states: 'A. LEFT SENTINEL LYMPH NODE #1 -. POSITIVE FOR METASTATIC CARCINOMA (1/1); THE TUMOR INVOLVES THREE-FOURTHS OF THE NODE WHICH MEASURES .6. CM. IN DIAMETER, NO PERICAPSULAR SOFT TISSUE EXTENSION.' This means that the node had cancer cells in 75% of its volume, and there was no evidence of soft tissue extension. The other two nodes (specimens B and C) were negative for metastatic carcinoma, as they had no cancer cells detected in them. Therefore, the N stage is N1, according to the 8th edition of the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual.
